metadata.titel_preek: The Love Olympics Go to Jerusalem

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of Divine Love (Christ) descending from the mountaintop of glory into the valley of human suffering and death to embrace the sufferer.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Love of God
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus turns his back on his glory and begins his descent into the valley.
He comes down from the mountain; he comes down from the throne of the majesty on high.
He reaches out, he comes down, to seek you, to find you, to embrace you.

object.identificatie: The human sufferer / The 'you' in pain
tekstueel_bewijs: to seek you, to find you, to embrace you
the embrace of God for all the misery of all the world

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The nature of True Love
tekstueel_bewijs: the voice of God himself declares Jesus to be his Son
God is not looking down with detachment
whatever your pain... he reaches out to seek you

helper.identificatie: Moses and Elijah (ratification); The Holy Spirit (implied in the 'power of the Word')
tekstueel_bewijs: The appearance of Moses and Elijah ratifies the designation of Jesus

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Suffering, and the 'Fallen Human Nature' that seeks to stay on the mountaintop.
tekstueel_bewijs: disfigurement and certain death in Jerusalem at the hands of his enemies
the valley of the shadow of death
our fallen human nature to want to build booths
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but 'certain death' and 'all the misery of all the world,' requiring a divine descent.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The disciple's imitation of Christ's descent in service to others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Disciple / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly framed as a consequence of the primary: 'Whenever you do this, you are becoming Jesus’ disciple.'

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus turns his blazing face toward disfigurement.
He reaches out, he comes down, to seek you.
God is not looking down with detachment.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We don’t want to come down from the high.
Whenever you do this, you are becoming Jesus’ disciple.

voorbeelden: Love must go where it is most needed.
It is part of our fallen human nature to want to build booths.
He knows he cannot stay on the summit.
in the power of his Word spoken, he reaches out.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on Christ's 'ability' and 'action' to descend, rather than the hearer's 'obligation' to climb.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Mountaintop' (S1-Glory) through the 'Valley' (~S2) to the 'Embrace' (S1-Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ resolves the distance by physically moving from S1 (Glory) to S2 (Death) to reclaim the Receiver.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and cancer are treated as real enemies, not metaphors.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the active subject of almost all salvific verbs. The hearer is positioned as the one lying on the pavement needing help, not the one providing it.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the 'Whenever you do this' section.
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Whenever you do this, you are becoming Jesus’ disciple.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He comes down... to seek you, to find you, to embrace you.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: MLK and the Grandmother are used as icons of Christ's love, but they are subordinate to Christ's primary action.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jesus (as the model of mature love)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by stating Christ is the one who 'is' the love described in 1 Cor 13.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, comfort, and a sense of being 'found' in suffering.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: God initiates the movement toward the helpless.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cultural 'Love Olympics' to the 'Descent of Christ' is perfectly integrated.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He is about to become in his own person the embrace of God for all the misery of all the world.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Power of the Word' acts as the vehicle for Christ's presence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as the 'fallen nature' that avoids the valley.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the 'Exhortation Trap' by making the ethical move a participation in an already-occurring divine movement.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace.'

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon brilliantly subverts the moralistic tendency to turn 1 Corinthians 13 into a 'to-do list,' instead revealing it as a 'to-be-loved' reality.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the Valentine's Day hook; Greimas reveals the 'Descent' as the structural engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Transfiguration; Greimas shows how the Transfiguration functions as a 'Subject-departure' toward an 'Object-recovery.'
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Grandmother' and 'MLK' are not just examples, but 'Helpers' that mirror the primary 'Subject' (Christ).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Subject-Switch' technique effectively by moving from the 'Love Olympics' (Man as Subject) to 'Jerusalem' (Christ as Subject).
